title: Revert global button regressions and restore pre-calendar splash card motion

requirements.summary: Restore pre-calendar button sizing, borders/shadows, typography, and hover/active/disabled interactions across all pages while preventing Calendar-specific styles from leaking globally.
acceptanceCriteria: Buttons on Splash/Onboarding (Prev/Next/Sign In), Welcome (Get Started/Sign Out), Home (navigation + promo CTA), Camera (capture/retake/save/upload/back), Moments (back/navigation), Calendar (month nav, date cells, back/menu), and Settings (back/logout) visually match the pre-calendar button styling.
No global CSS class or selector causes unintended button styling changes outside of its intended scope (e.g., Calendar-specific styles do not affect other pages).
All button hover/active/disabled interactions behave consistently and match the pre-calendar experience (including any prior scale/press effects and cursor/opacity behavior).

file_operations.description: Rework button-related CSS to match the pre-calendar baseline: define shared, non-leaky button utility classes (e.g., primary CTA, small CTA, circular icon button, footer camera button) with the prior sizes, border treatments, shadows, typography, and hover/active/disabled interaction behavior. Remove/avoid any overly broad styling that could accidentally affect all <button> elements, and ensure any Calendar-only styling remains explicitly scoped to Calendar-specific classes.

Update Splash/Onboarding Prev/Next/Sign In button class usage to rely on the restored shared button utilities (and not any Calendar-introduced/global overrides), ensuring consistent hover/active/disabled behavior and matching pre-calendar sizing/typography.
Align Welcome page buttons (Get Started, Sign Out) to the restored shared button utilities to ensure pre-calendar sizing, typography, and interaction states.

Normalize Home page buttons (header icon buttons, promo CTA, footer navigation including camera button) to use the restored shared button utilities so borders/shadows, sizes, and hover/active states match pre-calendar behavior.

Update Camera screen controls (close/back, capture, retake, save, retry) to use the restored shared button utilities so interaction behavior (press/scale, disabled opacity/cursor) matches the pre-calendar experience.
Update Moments page header buttons and empty-state CTA to use the restored shared button utilities and ensure consistent hover/active behavior without altering the overall design.

Ensure Calendar page buttons (back/menu, month navigation, date cells) use Calendar-scoped styling only (no shared CTA styling leakage) and confirm their hover/active/disabled behavior remains consistent and does not affect other pages.
Update Settings page back and logout row/button interactions to use the restored shared button utilities (where applicable) so hover/active/disabled behavior matches pre-calendar.

requirements.summary: Restore Splash/Onboarding slide card transitions, layering, and per-card entrance animations to the pre-calendar motion behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Slide transitions between cards (auto-play and Prev/Next) animate smoothly and match the pre-calendar timing/easing and directional behavior.
Card content entrance animations (number + heading lines + media) are visible and behave as they did pre-calendar (no missing animations or broken classes).
During transitions, the correct card is clickable (pointer events) and visually stacked (z-index/layering) as expected; there is no flicker or unexpected disappearance.

file_operations.description: Restore/define the Splash/Onboarding motion CSS used pre-calendar: add back the missing card transition classes (for forward/back directions), ensure timing/easing matches the prior feel, and reinstate per-card entrance animation classes for the number, heading lines, and media. Ensure the animation classes used by MobileSplashScreen exist and are not overridden by unrelated styles.

Refit the slideshow transition logic to the restored pre-calendar animation behavior: synchronize JS transition timing with the CSS animation duration/easing, ensure correct directionality for Prev/Next and autoplay, and adjust layering/pointer-events/visibility handling to prevent flicker while guaranteeing only the intended active card is interactive. Ensure per-card entrance animations reliably retrigger when the active card changes.
